concise_definition: n. 坏掉的车辆/船只/飞机; 残骸; v. 毁坏, 沉没, 摧毁

definitions.explanation_en: The remains of a vehicle, ship, or aircraft that has been severely damaged or destroyed, especially after an accident or disaster.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因事故或灾难而严重损坏或摧毁后的车辆、船只或飞机的残骸。
definitions.example_en: Rescue teams searched the ocean floor for the wreckage of the lost submarine.
definitions.example_cn: 救援队在海底搜寻失踪潜艇的残骸。

definitions.explanation_en: A person who is physically or mentally ruined, often due to addiction, illness, or extreme hardship.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因成瘾、疾病或极度困境而身心崩溃的人。
definitions.example_en: After years of alcohol abuse, he was a shadow of his former self—a complete wreck.
definitions.example_cn: 多年酗酒后，他已形同虚设，彻底垮掉了。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause severe damage or destruction to something, especially a vehicle or structure, often through accident or violence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过事故或暴力对某物（尤指车辆或建筑）造成严重损坏或摧毁。
definitions.example_en: The storm wrecked dozens of homes along the coast.
definitions.example_cn: 这场风暴摧毁了沿海数十栋房屋。

definitions.explanation_en: To ruin or destroy someone’s health, emotions, or life, often metaphorically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指（隐喻性地）毁掉某人的健康、情绪或人生。
definitions.example_en: The stress of the trial nearly wrecked her mental health.
definitions.example_cn: 这场审判的压力几乎摧毁了她的心理健康。

comparison.analysis: “Destroy” (摧毁) 是一个更广泛、更彻底的词，强调完全消除某物的存在或功能，可用于抽象概念（如摧毁信心）或具体物体。而 “wreck” 更常用于物理性破坏，尤其指交通工具或建筑因事故而损毁，带有突发性和灾难性的语义色彩。
“Crash” (碰撞/坠毁) 通常指高速撞击导致的事故，是造成 wreck 的常见原因，但本身不等于残骸。例如：The car crashed into a tree.（车撞上了树）→ The car was a wreck afterward.（车成了残骸）。Crash 强调动作过程，wreck 强调结果状态。
“Ruin” (毁坏/毁灭) 可用于抽象或具体对象，强调价值、功能或状态的丧失，语气更持久、更缓慢，如“ruin a reputation”（毁掉声誉）。“Wreck” 更具视觉冲击力，常暗示突然的、剧烈的破坏，且多用于物理实体。
